articles.headline: Cain Speaks Out to Deny Accusations; 2nd Voice Heard
articles.snippet: Herman Cain held a news conference Tuesday to again deny the accusations, even as a another woman put her name to allegations that the candidate had approached her inappropriately.
articles.abstract: Herman Cain held a news conference Tuesday to again deny the accusations, even as a another woman put her name to allegations that the candidate had approached her inappropriately.
articles.lead_paragraph: Herman Cain, the embattled Republican candidate for president, convened a nationally televised news conference Tuesday in which he insisted that he is innocent of all sexual harassment accusations, even as another woman put her name to allegations that he had approached her inappropriately.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Jim Rutenberg and Mike McIntire

articles.headline: Government Counting Sheep? Now, Only in Its Dreams
articles.snippet: The Agriculture Department is eliminating dozens of reports on product inventories, including those for catfish, hops and trout, alarming the farmers who depend on the figures.
articles.abstract: The Agriculture Department is eliminating dozens of reports on product inventories, including those for catfish, hops and trout, alarming the farmers who depend on the figures.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last year, Wisconsin led the nation in mink farming, producing 833,430 pelts. Texas was the undisputed king of pansies, growing 1.8 million flats of the flowers. And no state harvested more hops than Washington, with 24,336 acres.

articles.headline: Air Force Officials Disciplined Over Handling of Human Remains
articles.snippet: Three were disciplined for “gross mismanagement,” including the loss of slain service members’ body parts.
articles.abstract: Three were disciplined for “gross mismanagement,” including the loss of slain service members’ body parts.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Three senior officials at Dover Air Force Base in Delaware, sacred ground for the military and the main entry point for the nation’s war dead, knew they had lost body parts of two service members killed in Afghanistan but did nothing to correct sloppy practices at the base mortuary, the Air Force said Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Bumiller and James Dao

articles.headline: U.N. Agency Says Iran Data Points to A-Bomb Work
articles.snippet: International weapons inspectors say a trove of new evidence makes a “credible” case that Iran has been developing a nuclear weapon.
articles.abstract: International weapons inspectors say a trove of new evidence makes a “credible” case that Iran has been developing a nuclear weapon.
articles.lead_paragraph: United Nations weapons inspectors have amassed a trove of new evidence that they say makes a “credible” case that “Iran has carried out activities relevant to the development of a nuclear device,” and that the project may still be under way.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and William J. Broad

articles.headline: Political Ad Spending Spurs Local TV Mergers
articles.snippet: The election cycle of 2012 is expected to be very lucrative for some stations, which will also benefit from charging cable and satellite distributors for the rights to retransmit their signals.
articles.abstract: The election cycle of 2012 is expected to be very lucrative for some stations, which will also benefit from charging cable and satellite distributors for the rights to retransmit their signals.
articles.lead_paragraph: A period of consolidation is under way in local television — and with it, a renewed debate about the implications of merger and acquisition activity on the industry.

articles.headline: How a Financial Pro Lost His House
articles.snippet: A financial planner recounts how he and his family fell victim to the housing boom and bust and how they survived the ordeal.
articles.abstract: A financial planner recounts how he and his family fell victim to the housing boom and bust and how they survived the ordeal.
articles.lead_paragraph: ONE night a few years ago, when the value of our home had collapsed, our debt was out of control and my financial planning business was shaky, I went to take out the trash.

articles.headline: Shares Dive as Olympus Scrambles for Answers
articles.snippet: As the company struggled to contain a scandal over payments made to cover losses on investments on Wednesday, its stock fell another 20 percent.
articles.abstract: As the company struggled to contain a scandal over payments made to cover losses on investments on Wednesday, its stock fell another 20 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: From the board room to the trading floor, Olympus struggled on Tuesday to contain a crisis that erupted after its admission that it had used $1 billion in payments to cover up losses on investments.

articles.headline: Ohio Turns Back a Law Limiting Unions’ Rights
articles.snippet: Voters in Ohio delivered their verdict on a centerpiece of the conservative legislative agenda.
articles.abstract: Voters in Ohio delivered their verdict on a centerpiece of the conservative legislative agenda.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio — A year after Republicans swept legislatures across the country, voters in Ohio delivered their verdict Tuesday on a centerpiece of the conservative legislative agenda, striking down a law that restricted public workers’ rights to bargain collectively.

articles.headline: Occupy Movement Inspires Unions to Embrace Bold Tactics
articles.snippet: Labor leaders, who were cautious at first, have embraced the Occupy movement, and protesters have joined their picket lines across the nation.
articles.abstract: Labor leaders, who were cautious at first, have embraced the Occupy movement, and protesters have joined their picket lines across the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Organized labor’s early flirtation with Occupy Wall Street is starting to get serious.

articles.headline: Fear of Contagion Rocks Markets
articles.snippet: Investors dumped their holdings of Italian government bonds, prompting a global stock market sell-off.
articles.abstract: Investors dumped their holdings of Italian government bonds, prompting a global stock market sell-off.
articles.lead_paragraph: Europe’s efforts to stem financial contagion foundered on Wednesday as investors dumped their holdings of Italian government bonds, prompting a global stock market sell-off.
articles.byline: By Graham Bowley, Christine Hauser and Nelson D. Schwartz
